sentences.en: ...the right to silence in police interrogations.
sentences.cn: …在警察审问时保持沉默的权利。

sentences.en: He confessed to the crime during his interrogation.
sentences.cn: 在讯问中他供认了犯罪.

sentences.en: He seemed shaken after the interrogation.
sentences.cn: 审讯后他似乎惊惶不已.

sentences.en: His superiority in the interrogation room was not based on intellect or physique.
sentences.cn: 他在审问室里的优势并不是以智谋和体力为基础建立的.

sentences.en: Jones elected to conduct Hanley's interrogation himself.
sentences.cn: 琼斯决定亲自审问汉利.

sentences.en: Police say she was cool and collected during her interrogation.
sentences.cn: 警方说她在审问过程中表现得冷静自若。

sentences.en: Soon Brown himself came back for consultation and received the usual rapid - fire Kennedy interrogation.
sentences.cn: 不久,布朗本人回国述职,受到肯尼迪惯常用的连珠炮般的询问.

sentences.en: The prisoner gave way under interrogation.
The suspect was marched to the police station for interrogation.
sentences.cn: 嫌疑犯被押赴警察局听候讯问.

sentences.en: Their very existence was a note of interrogation to the claims of the church.
sentences.cn: 他们的存在本身就是对教会主张的一种怀疑.

sentences.en: There was an eddy of surprise and interrogation.
sentences.cn: 人群里激起了惊奇和诘问的喊声.

sentences.en: Under interrogation, he refused to say anything at first.
sentences.cn: 一开始审问的时候, 他什么也不说.

sentences.en: We sat cross - legged on the matting and the interrogation began.
sentences.cn: 我们 盘腿 坐在“塌塌米”上,审讯便开始了.

sentences.en: You'll have to tell us how much interrogation they can stand, Doctor.
sentences.cn: 到时候你得告诉我们, 医生,他们经受得住多少盘问.

trans.tran_en: An interrogation is the act of interrogating someone
